stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements identifies the greatest single reason that the value of Kp for the overall reaction at 298 K has such a large magnitude?

features.html:
H2(g) + Cl2(g) ⇄ 2 HCl(g)      Kp = 2 × 1030 at 298 K

 

HCl(g) can be synthesized from H2(g) and Cl2(g) as represented above. A student studying the kinetics of the reaction proposes the following mechanism

Step 1: Cl2(g) → 2 Cl(g)                             (slow)        ∆H° = 242 kJ/molrxn
Step 2: H2(g) + Cl(g) → HCl(g) + H(g)       (fast)         ∆H° = 4 kJ/molrxn
Step 3: H(g) + Cl(g) → HCl(g)                   (fast)        ∆H° = -432 kJ/molrxn

choicesHtml: The activation energy for step 1 of the mechanism is large and positive.
The activation energy for step 2 of the mechanism is small and positive.
The value of ΔS° for the overall reaction is small and positive.
The value of ΔH° for the overall reaction is large and negative.
